info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 1:32PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Fulton County through 200 PM EDT... At 131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cranberry Creek, or 9 miles north of Gloversville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and areas of poor drainage. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Mayfield, Northampton Beach Public Campground, Cranberry Creek, Bleecker, Riceville, Bleecker Center, Sweets Crossing, Pinnacle, Bowlers Corners, Peters Corners, Lindsley Corners, Broadalbin Junction, Dennies Hollow, Tomantown, Osbourne Bridge, Dennies Crossing, Kingsboro and Jackson Summit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
